title: The Daily Beast hires Lachlan Markay - POLITICO
text:
The Daily Beast is hiring Lachlan Markay as its new White House Reporter, the site will announce on Wednesday. Markay joins from The Washington Free Beacon, where he's worked since 2013, and where he built a name for himself as a conservative journalist focusing on money and politics.
Markay will represent the publication in the White House briefing room "and keep close watch on Trump's intermingling of business and political interests," the site said in a statement.
“In an administration where the media has been labeled the 'opposition party,' Lachlan brings both a conservative voice and talent for providing new facts and the critical questioning necessary for reporting from today’s White House," said Daily Beast Editor-in-Chief John Avlon. "We are excited to welcome him as part of our growing roster of reform Republican columnists, including Matt Lewis, Nick Gillespie, Stuart Stevens, Rick Wilson, Jamie Kirchick, among others.”
"It's a top notch team that's doing a great job covering a watershed moment in American history and I can't wait to be part of it. I have nothing but love for the Free Beacon and I know they'll continue doing amazing work," Markay said in a statement.
Markay joins The Daily Beast just a few weeks after the site lost one of its political reporters , Olivia Nuzzi, to New York magazine.
